availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph W. Beagle (Harrison County, KY, resident)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Father of John Beagle and Elizabeth Boone Beagle. Married to Telitha Jane Bell Beagle in Harrison County in 1858. Father of Martha E. Beagle. Student in Harrison County in 1850. Signed a petition to James R. Curry in support of James A. Baird for magistrate in Colemansville in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 318B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Berrys District, p. 86A.
Eleventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1890), Veteran Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Berry, p. 1.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #6805.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film #000216897, p. 395.
"Joseph W. Beagle (1836-1915)," Find A Grave, Memorial #46778312, accessed September 8, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/46778312.
